snippet: From its opening moments, the debate devolved into a series of searing exchanges over one overarching theme: which of the two Democrats was the most progressive.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Bernie Sanders engage in back-and-forth that is at times acerbic and harsh, in New Hampshire debate ahead of state's Democratic primary; clashes focus on which candidate is more politically progressive and over campaign financing, with Sanders accusing Clinton of being in thrall to wealthy corporations and Wall Street.

byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and PATRICK HEALY

lead_paragraph: From its opening moments, the debate devolved into a series of searing exchanges over one overarching theme: which of the two Democrats was the most progressive.

headline.main: In Democratic Debate, Candidates Clash on Money’s Role
headline.print_headline: Democrats Clash on Money’s Role in Bitter Debate
